atomic_tests.name: Enumerate all accounts (Domain)
atomic_tests.description:
Enumerate all accounts
Upon exection, multiple enumeration commands will be run and their output displayed in the PowerShell session

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate all accounts via PowerShell (Domain)
atomic_tests.description: Enumerate all accounts via PowerShell. Upon execution, lots of user account and group information will be displayed.

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate logged on users via CMD (Domain)
atomic_tests.description: Enumerate logged on users. Upon exeuction, logged on users will be displayed.

input_arguments.description: Name of remote system to query

atomic_tests.name: Automated AD Recon (ADRecon)
atomic_tests.description:
ADRecon extracts and combines information about an AD environement into a report. Upon execution, an Excel file with all of the data will be generated and its
path will be displayed.

input_arguments.description: Path of ADRecon.ps1 file

dependencies.description: ADRecon must exist on disk at specified location (#{adrecon_path})

atomic_tests.name: Adfind -Listing password policy
atomic_tests.description:
Adfind tool can be used for reconnaissance in an Active directory environment. The example chosen illustrates adfind used to query the local password policy.
reference- http://www.joeware.net/freetools/tools/adfind/, https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/7535.adfind-command-examples.aspx

executor.name: command_prompt
executor.procedure: "PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads\AdFind.exe" #{optional_args} -default -s base lockoutduration lockoutthreshold lockoutobservationwindow maxpwdage minpwdage minpwdlength pwdhistorylength pwdproperties

input_arguments.description: Allows defining arguments to add to the adfind command to tailor it to the specific needs of the environment. Use "-arg" notation to add arguments separated by spaces.

dependencies.description: AdFind.exe must exist on disk at specified location (PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads\AdFind.exe)

atomic_tests.name: Adfind - Enumerate Active Directory Admins
atomic_tests.description:
Adfind tool can be used for reconnaissance in an Active directory environment. This example has been documented by ransomware actors enumerating Active Directory Admin accounts
reference- http://www.joeware.net/freetools/tools/adfind/, https://stealthbits.com/blog/fun-with-active-directorys-admincount-attribute/

input_arguments.description: Allows defining arguments to add to the adfind command to tailor it to the specific needs of the environment. Use "-arg" notation to add arguments separated by spaces.

dependencies.description: AdFind.exe must exist on disk at specified location (PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads\AdFind.exe)

atomic_tests.description:
Adfind tool can be used for reconnaissance in an Active directory environment. This example has been documented by ransomware actors enumerating Active Directory User Objects
reference- http://www.joeware.net/freetools/tools/adfind/, https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/04/pick-six-intercepting-a-fin6-intrusion.html

input_arguments.description: Allows defining arguments to add to the adfind command to tailor it to the specific needs of the environment. Use "-arg" notation to add arguments separated by spaces.

dependencies.description: AdFind.exe must exist on disk at specified location (PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads\AdFind.exe)

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate Default Domain Admin Details (Domain)
atomic_tests.description: This test will enumerate the details of the built-in domain admin account

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate Active Directory for Unconstrained Delegation
atomic_tests.description:
Attackers may attempt to query for computer objects with the UserAccountControl property
'TRUSTED_FOR_DELEGATION' (0x80000;524288) set
More Information - https://shenaniganslabs.io/2019/01/28/Wagging-the-Dog.html#when-the-stars-align-unconstrained-delegation-leads-to-rce
Prerequisite: AD RSAT PowerShell module is needed and it must run under a domain user

input_arguments.description: Domain FQDN
UAC Property to search

dependencies.description: PowerShell ActiveDirectory Module must be installed

atomic_tests.name: Get-DomainUser with PowerView
atomic_tests.description: Utilizing PowerView, run Get-DomainUser to identify the domain users. Upon execution, Users within the domain will be listed.

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate Active Directory Users with ADSISearcher
atomic_tests.description:
The following Atomic test will utilize ADSISearcher to enumerate users within Active Directory.
Upon successful execution a listing of users will output with their paths in AD.
Reference: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/scripting/use-the-powershell-adsisearcher-type-accelerator-to-search-active-directory/

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate Linked Policies In ADSISearcher Discovery
atomic_tests.description:
The following Atomic test will utilize ADSISearcher to enumerate organizational unit within Active Directory.
Upon successful execution a listing of users will output with their paths in AD.
Reference: https://medium.com/@pentesttas/discover-hidden-gpo-s-on-active-directory-using-ps-adsi-a284b6814c81

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate Root Domain linked policies Discovery
atomic_tests.description:
The following Atomic test will utilize ADSISearcher to enumerate root domain unit within Active Directory.
Upon successful execution a listing of users will output with their paths in AD.
Reference: https://medium.com/@pentesttas/discover-hidden-gpo-s-on-active-directory-using-ps-adsi-a284b6814c81

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - generaldomaininfo
atomic_tests.description: Gathers general domain information using the generaldomaininfo function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: Kerbrute - userenum
atomic_tests.description: Enumerates active directory usernames using the userenum function of Kerbrute

input_arguments.description: Domain that is being tested against
Domain Controller that is being tested against

dependencies.description: username text file must exist in PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads.

atomic_tests.name: Wevtutil - Discover NTLM Users Remote
atomic_tests.description:
This test discovers users who have authenticated against a Domain Controller via NTLM. 
This is done remotely via wmic and captures the event code 4776 from the domain controller and stores the ouput in C:\temp. [Reference](https://www.reliaquest.com/blog/socgholish-fakeupdates/)

executor.name: powershell
executor.procedure:
$target = $env:LOGONSERVER
$target = $target.Trim("\\")
$IpAddress = [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostAddresses($target) | select IPAddressToString -ExpandProperty IPAddressToString
wmic.exe /node:$IpAddress process call create 'wevtutil epl Security C:\\ntlmusers.evtx /q:\"Event[System[(EventID=4776)]]"'

atomic_tests.name: Suspicious LAPS Attributes Query with Get-ADComputer all properties
atomic_tests.description: This test executes LDAP query using powershell command Get-ADComputer and lists all the properties including Microsoft LAPS attributes ms-mcs-AdmPwd and ms-mcs-AdmPwdExpirationTime

input_arguments.description: Name of the host

atomic_tests.name: Suspicious LAPS Attributes Query with Get-ADComputer ms-Mcs-AdmPwd property
atomic_tests.description: This test executes LDAP query using powershell command Get-ADComputer and lists Microsoft LAPS attributes ms-mcs-AdmPwd and ms-mcs-AdmPwdExpirationTime

input_arguments.description: Name of the host

atomic_tests.name: Suspicious LAPS Attributes Query with Get-ADComputer all properties and SearchScope
atomic_tests.description: This test executes LDAP query using powershell command Get-ADComputer with SearchScope as subtree and lists all the properties including Microsoft LAPS attributes ms-mcs-AdmPwd and ms-mcs-AdmPwdExpirationTime

input_arguments.description: Allows defining arguments to add to the adfind command to tailor it to the specific needs of the environment. Use "-arg" notation to add arguments separated by spaces.

atomic_tests.name: Active Directory Domain Search
atomic_tests.description: Output information from LDAPSearch. LDAP Password is the admin-user password on Active Directory

input_arguments.description: The domain to be tested
The top level domain (.com, .test, .remote, etc... following domain, minus the .)
username@domain of a user within the ad database
password of the user with admin privileges referenced in admin_user

dependencies.description: Packages sssd-ad sssd-tools realmd adcli installed and realm available, ldapsearch

atomic_tests.name: Account Enumeration with LDAPDomainDump
atomic_tests.description:
This test uses LDAPDomainDump to perform account enumeration on a domain.
[Reference](https://securityonline.info/ldapdomaindump-active-directory-information-dumper-via-ldap/)

input_arguments.description: Username and domain to authenticate with
IP to connect to
Password to authenticate with

dependencies.prereq_command: if [ -x "$(command -v python3 --version)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;
if [ -x "$(command -v pip --version)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;

dependencies.description: The ldapdomaindump module must be installed
The future module must be installed
